result.execSummary:
The defendant Stefan M Hart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered restitution payable to Educator's Credit Union in the amount of $750.00 converted forthwith to civil judgment with tax intercept

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stefan M Hart

records.addlTxt: Restitution packet, Check issued March 14 2019.
Restitution Check Packet. er

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: File presented to Case Closing this date

Defendant Stefan M Hart in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentenced defendant to serve TWO (2) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for TWO (2) DAYS served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 10-31-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

On Motion of the State,  Court ordered Restitution payable to EDUCATOR'S CREDIT UNION in the amount of SEVEN HUNDRED FIFTY DOLLARS ($750.00) CONVERTED FORTHWITH TO CIVIL JUDGMENT with TAX INTERCEPT.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Stefan M Hart in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has completed TWENTY-ONE (21) HOURS of Community Service at Frieden's Community Ministries.  State advised that Defendant needs to pay SEVEN HUNDRED FIFTY DOLLARS ($750.00) in Restitution towards his Misdemeanor matter.  Defense concurred.    Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
Matter is RESCHEDULED to 06-20-2016 at 08:30 am.  sdg

Attorney Rosemary Reyes-Cuevas appeared on behalf of the Defendant.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that Defendant believed sentencing was tomorrow.  Court ordered matter adjourned to 04-27-2016 at 11:00 am for Sentencing.  COURT ISSUED AND STAYED A BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.

Defendant Stefan M Hart in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State renewed their motion to revoke.  Defense conceded there is a factual basis to revoke the DPA but advised that the Defendant DID complete the Letter of Apology AND Community Service.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Court TERMINATED JusticePoint involvement in this matter.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Stefan M Hart in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State moved to revoke the DPA.  Defense objected and requested matter be staffed.  Court takes the State's motion to revoke under advisement at this time.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Stefan M Hart in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense reports that Defendant is now employed.  State requests that assessment fee be paid as well as over $700.00 in restitution.  Defendant has completed Community Service.  Defendant will need to pay at LEAST $375.00 as well as proof of payment.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Stefan M Hart in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Defense reports that Defendant has written the apology letter but has NOT completed Community Service.  Restitution has not ben paid as the Defendant has recently become employed.  Review hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point DPA Progress Report. Filed, sdg.

Defendant Stefan M Hart in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant has gained employment.  Defendant needs to complete community service and make payments towards restitutuion.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Stefan M Hart in court with student Intern Nicole Brandenvehl under the supervision of attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 6/15/15 @ 1:30pm
